8.text:
Deep, in a village hidden in the hills,
Rests an orphanage, on a muddy slope...

15.text:
Inside a small child cries
For the mother who abandoned her…

19.text:
A young boy in tattered jeans, feigns a smile,
Last week.. his mother died...but in his world,

26.text:
this is normal.
An ugly old woman snaps, as her cane strikes

32.text: hard, onto the bare back of another teenager.

35.text:
Skin whipped, another lash - the conformity
is beaten back into her.

41.text:
The tax some pay, for a life with less struggle
and stress

44.text:
Blessed still, to have a roof above their
head, food, safety and, a shared bunk bed.

52.text: Francis, Peggy… now my heart hears you….

56.text:
Why & how, a quiet growl, buried deep, turns
into rumbling thunder

62.text:
Why & how, you carry on, buckle down, still...
remain innocent with wonder

68.text:
All your heartbeats and elbow grease,
Motivated by the sound of a single truth on

77.text:
No one is coming.
No one.

80.text: It is up to you now.

84.text:
Heaven is a construct, there’s no white
knight, no reincarnated saviour, no resurrection,

88.text: no judgement and definitely no caped crusader.

92.text:
From these hollow ashes, the only phoenix
rising is…

98.text:
Who needs Superman, when you’re working
super hard to supercharge, Super You.

106.text:
The brightest lights of our world, are disguised.
Secrets emerge, faults hidden from our view.

113.text: The heavy mask slips, decayed by the truth.

117.text:
So I get why you feel lost and alone in a
house full of people

121.text:
Glued to the other man on your phone, who
gives your relief and a giggle

128.text:
And why, you stuck around but at the cost
of your real freedom

131.text:
I look at you and see a body, but not the
vibrant soul I was used to.

136.text:
The stars of my sky glimmer yet, I can’t
help but feel a little less hopeful.

143.text:
Welcome to the real world, holding onto what
was, will only mislead you.

148.text:
I’m running away to the park, so for one
day,

151.text:
I don’t have to hear the abuse & the screams
Words fly around, that are wicked, vicious,

157.text:
and mean
I’m hiding behind the stairs, but still

160.text:
always getting caught in between
Years later, little wiser but the scene still

166.text:
repeats.
Every scar has been earned, in search of the

170.text:
strength to survive
Get up, dust off, show my dimples, smile for

176.text:
The pain some endure, as their eyes search
out for a hero.

182.text:
Trapped in the dirt, Believe they’re cursed,
slums, poverty, empty bellies and malaria

186.text:
Another day, more abuse, a tattered jacket,
working in heat till hysteria.

192.text:
Every cut might be deep, but battle scars
are for warriors

196.text:
In stormy waters, a skinny little kid learnt
only how to thrive.

200.text:
Of how to stay kind, how not to be nice, how
a sound from a wicked mouth can create much

206.text:
strife
How life is unfair, but we still hold the

210.text: power to choose what is right.

213.text:
Everytime we feel pain, we lash out with more
hate

217.text:
We hold onto it, like it's precious
and the cycle is ingrained into fate.

223.text:
Sorrow comes from the truth you are weeping
for

226.text:
And real love appears, when we realise inside,
is the real war

232.text:
All people need someone to look upto
But people are only projections of the fixed

237.text:
images we set
A memory or idea captured from a static moment

242.text:
in time
Until it’s safe to say, we’ve made a box,

246.text:
it's all nice and neat
The only constant in life though, is that

250.text:
there will be defeats,
Our mental images expire, in the moment we

255.text:
arrange them
So eyesight you have, but not a clear vision

260.text:
You already know you are the one that you
need,

263.text:
Stop looking outside for a hero to inject
imto you more belief

267.text:
Cos when the chips are down, you are the one
who must lead

271.text:
It’s agreed, you will bleed, and you will
stumble and you will scream

274.text:
You will beg, you will plead
For the love outside that you are convinced

279.text:
See the only drama is the suffering you have
practiced

283.text:
The Ancient Toltecs taught me one clear thing
That real self Love is a habit.

289.text:
A mindset to be adapted, a way of living to
be practiced

293.text:
And the only real way is to put your images
in a casket

298.text:
Imagine you’re wearing tinted glasses, so
what you see is not valid

302.text:
The world transforms into whatever we claim
it to be

306.text:
There is power in what you can do
There is strength in where you can go

312.text: And there is light in unveiling the real you.

315.text:
Anyway... I’m done,
Back to silence, trying to find peace.

322.text:
This journey is all about the realisation
of who I really am.
